Bring a Column to Position 1

<<<<<<< HEAD Source: R/position.R ======= >>>>>>> cf1e04cd1c7ac9a4ae0ffe3bb264178f3d9b9cd7
to_position_1.Rd

Bring a Column to Position 1

to_position_1(data, col)

Arguments

data

A dataframe or tibble.
col

Target column.

See also

select,reexports

Examples

library(tidyverse)
test_data <- 
        tibble(A = sample(c(NA_integer_, 1:3), size = 10, replace = TRUE),
               B = sample(c(NA_integer_, 4:6), size = 10, replace = TRUE),
               C = sample(c(NA_integer_, 7:9), size = 10, replace = TRUE),
               D = sample(c(NA_integer_, 10:12), size = 10, replace = TRUE),
               E = sample(c(NA_integer_, 13:15), size = 10, replace = TRUE),
               )


# To Position 1
to_position_1(data = test_data,
              col = D)

#> # A tibble: 10 x 5
#>        D     A     B     C     E
#>    <int> <int> <int> <int> <int>
#>  1    12    NA     4     9    13
#>  2    11     3     4     7    15
#>  3    NA     3     5     8    15
#>  4    NA     3     4     7    NA
#>  5    10     3     6     8    NA
#>  6    11     1     5     9    14
#>  7    10     2     4     8    13
#>  8    NA     3     6     8    15
#>  9    NA     2    NA     9    NA
#> 10    12     2     6     9    14

# To Last Position
to_last_position(data = test_data,
                 col = B)

#> # A tibble: 10 x 5
#>        A     C     D     E     B
#>    <int> <int> <int> <int> <int>
#>  1    NA     9    12    13     4
#>  2     3     7    11    15     4
#>  3     3     8    NA    15     5
#>  4     3     7    NA    NA     4
#>  5     3     8    10    NA     6
#>  6     1     9    11    14     5
#>  7     2     8    10    13     4
#>  8     3     8    NA    15     6
#>  9     2     9    NA    NA    NA
#> 10     2     9    12    14     6


# To Last Position
to_position_n(data = test_data,
              col = B,
              n = 3)

#> # A tibble: 10 x 5
#>        A     C     B     D     E
#>    <int> <int> <int> <int> <int>
#>  1    NA     9     4    12    13
#>  2     3     7     4    11    15
#>  3     3     8     5    NA    15
#>  4     3     7     4    NA    NA
#>  5     3     8     6    10    NA
#>  6     1     9     5    11    14
#>  7     2     8     4    10    13
#>  8     3     8     6    NA    15
#>  9     2     9    NA    NA    NA
#> 10     2     9     6    12    14

to_position_n(data = test_data,
              col = B,
              n = 4)

#> # A tibble: 10 x 5
#>        A     C     D     B     E
#>    <int> <int> <int> <int> <int>
#>  1    NA     9    12     4    13
#>  2     3     7    11     4    15
#>  3     3     8    NA     5    15
#>  4     3     7    NA     4    NA
#>  5     3     8    10     6    NA
#>  6     1     9    11     5    14
#>  7     2     8    10     4    13
#>  8     3     8    NA     6    15
#>  9     2     9    NA    NA    NA
#> 10     2     9    12     6    14

to_position_n(data = test_data,
              col = B,
              n = 2)

#> # A tibble: 10 x 5
#>        A     B     C     D     E
#>    <int> <int> <int> <int> <int>
#>  1    NA     4     9    12    13
#>  2     3     4     7    11    15
#>  3     3     5     8    NA    15
#>  4     3     4     7    NA    NA
#>  5     3     6     8    10    NA
#>  6     1     5     9    11    14
#>  7     2     4     8    10    13
#>  8     3     6     8    NA    15
#>  9     2    NA     9    NA    NA
#> 10     2     6     9    12    14
